intro: Boechera zephyra, commonly known as the skyblue mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, rounded leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Boechera zephyra is also notable for its ability to produce seeds that can remain viable for extended periods in the soil.
